newsitem.title: USA: Democrats may try to delay House vote on Gingrich.
newsitem.headline: Democrats may try to delay House vote on Gingrich.

text.p: House of Representatives Democrats may try to delay a vote on re-electing Newt Gingrich as speaker on Tuesday until the Ethics Committee finishes its work on charges against him in the next few weeks.

The House was scheduled to vote for speaker later on Tuesday. House Democratic Leader Dick Gephardt, speaking to reporters after a closed-door meeting, said Democrats were exploring whether a procedural motion to delay the vote was possible.
"We may move to postpone this vote until the ethics process is finished with the speaker. A number of us believe that would be the best thing to do," Gephardt said.

"We are not trying and never have tried to get a Democrat to be speaker. We did not win the election, that is not our purpose," he said, adding that Democrats wanted someone in the speaker's chair "who brings credit to the office."

Gephardt said he did not know whether any Republicans -- who hold a 227 to 207 majority in the House with one independent who usually votes with the Democrats -- would support a move to delay the vote.
The re-election of Gingrich has been thrown into doubt because he face probable discipline for admitted breaches of House ethics rules.
